page.title: 08BRIDGE OF WEIR - THE ARTS
page.content: { Bridge of Weir}Players,who celebrate their{50th}anniversary this year,meet weekly from Sep-March in Cargill Hall. They normally present two productions per year,and{Christmas pantomimes}such as{"Little Jo Peep"}and{"Little Fred {Riding Hood",}written by{Ernest Smyth a member of the club. At the moment, including club officials,membership is around{30.}It costs around{Â£400}to make a production.The club issue a newsletter called{"Upstage"}to inform everyone of events. { The Choral Society}meet weekly from Sep-March, and{40}members work towards performing an{oratorio}or{religious {Cantata,}but produce a lighter concert with a Victorian or Edwardian theme early in the year.Their most recent performance was{"Keep Smiling Through" to celebrate the{40th anniversary}of {V.E. Day.
